prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Rayfa:
All members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks upon them.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The main characters here are Maya Fey, Ema Skye, and others, but the key focus is on the evidence and testimonies provided. The case revolves around the death of Puhray Zeh'lot, an apprentice priest who was killed in the Plaza of Devotion.

Looking at the evidence, I see several items listed. One of them is Evidence 16, which is a crime photo of Zeh'lot's body. The description mentions that he has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck. Additionally, Rayfa Padma Khura'in, the priestess, mentions that all members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks. This suggests that the tattoo is significant and possibly indicative of his status or role within the clergy.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Ema Skye provides several statements. In Testimony 3, she says, "He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest." This implies that Zeh'lot's death might have been a case of mistaken identity, where he was targeted because of his association with the high priest or his role in the clergy.

The contradiction arises when considering the evidence about the tattoo. If all members of the clergy have such marks, as Rayfa mentioned, then Zeh'lot's tattoo would be a clear identifier of his status. However, Ema's testimony suggests that he might have been mistaken for a rebel. If the tattoo was visible and known to be a sign of clergy membership, it's unlikely that he would be mistaken for a rebel. This creates a contradiction because the evidence (the tattoo) indicates he was clearly identified as clergy, while the testimony suggests he was possibly misidentified.

So, the evidence (Zeh'lot's tattoo) and the testimony (Ema's statement about mistaken identity) contradict each other because the tattoo should have made his identity clear, preventing such a mistake.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The goal is to identify a single pair where the evidence and testimony provide conflicting information.

First, I'll start by reviewing the provided characters to understand who is involved in the case. The key individuals here are Ahlbi Ur'gaid, Maya Fey, Ema Skye, Tahrust Inmee, Nahyuta Sahdmadhi, Rayfa Padma Khura'in, Puhray Zeh'lot, and Beh'leeb Inmee. Tahrust Inmee is the high priest who was killed, and Puhray Zeh'lot is an apprentice priest who was also killed. The others are either involved in the investigation or have roles in the rites.

Next, I'll look through the evidences to understand the details of the case. Evidence 16 is a crime photo showing Zeh'lot's body with a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck. Evidence 17 states that Zeh'lot's cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon. Other relevant evidences include the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4), which was shut during the rite, and the Autopsy Report (Evidence 3), which details Tahrust's death.

Now, examining the testimonies, Testimony 0 from Tahrust Inmee mentions that he was entertaining His Magistry and his family when the crime occurred, and his wife Beh'leeb was in the kitchen cooking the entire time. He also heard a quarrel between Acolyte Zeh'lot and Acolyte Fey, followed by a loud noise and silence.

The key point here is that Tahrust claims he was entertaining guests and his wife was in the kitchen, suggesting he was present elsewhere during the crime. However, the crime photo (Evidence 16) shows Zeh'lot's body, and the autopsy report (Evidence 17) confirms his death by stabbing. Additionally, the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) was shut, indicating that the sanctum was isolated during the rite.

If Tahrust was entertaining guests in another area, it's unlikely he could have been the one to commit the crime. However, the evidence suggests that Zeh'lot was killed, and the circumstances around the crime (such as the closed ritual curtain) might imply that the killer was someone else who had access to the sanctum.

Therefore, the contradiction arises between Testimony 0, where Tahrust claims he was entertaining guests, and the evidence (specifically Evidence 16 and 17) that shows Zeh'lot's death occurred under circumstances that might implicate someone else.
</think>

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the provided information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The main characters here are the defendant, Ahlbi Ur'gaid, and the victim, Tahrust Inmee. There's also Maya Fey, who is a spirit medium, and others like Ema Skye, the detective.

Next, I'll examine the evidence listed. Evidence 23 is the Tome of Secrets, which mentions that the priestess must know Lady Kee'ra's name, Ihmsan, and that speaking it is unforgivable. This suggests that only someone with this knowledge could have impersonated Lady Kee'ra.

Looking at the testimonies, Tahrust Inmee claims that Maya Fey channeled Lady Kee'ra's spirit and killed him with supernatural strength. However, the Tome of Secrets indicates that only someone who knows Lady Kee'ra's true name can impersonate her. If Maya didn't have this knowledge, she couldn't have done it, contradicting Tahrust's testimony.

So, the contradiction lies between Evidence 23 (Tome of Secrets) and Testimony 0 (Tahrust's claim that Maya channeled Lady Kee'ra). The evidence suggests that Maya couldn't have impersonated Lady Kee'ra without knowing the secret name, while Tahrust's testimony implies she did.
</think>
